sen.j: 源 季遠（みなもと の すえとお、生没年不詳）は平安時代後期の武士・歌人。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Suetoo (year of birth and death unknown) was a busho (Japanese military commander) and a poet in the late Heian Period.
MINAMOTO no Suetoo (year of birth and death unknown) was a busho (Japanese military commander) and a poet in the late Heian Period.
MINAMOTO no Sueto (year of birth and death unknown) was a busho (Japanese military commander) and a poet in the late Heian Period.

sen.j: 平忠盛・平清盛の郎党。
sen.e: He was a retainer of TAIRA no Tadamori and TAIRA no Kiyomori.
He was a retainer of TAIRA no Tadamori and TAIRA no Kiyomori.
He was a retainer of TAIRA no Tadamori and TAIRA no Kiyomori.

sen.j: 子に、平家の侍大将の大夫判官源季貞らがいる。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Suesada, Taifu hogan (police and judicial chief with the fifth rank), who was Samurai-Daisho (commander of warriors) of the Taira family was his son.
MINAMOTO no Suesada, Taifu hogan (police and judicial chief with the fifth rank), who was Samurai-Daisho (commander of warriors) of the Taira family was his son.
MINAMOTO no Suesada, Taifu hogan (police and judicial chief with the fifth rank), who was Samurai-Daisho (commander of warriors) of the Taira family was his son.

sen.j: 勅撰和歌集（詞花和歌集）に、子の源季貞（千載和歌集）とともに入選しているが、著名な歌人ではない。
sen.e: He was not a famous poet, although his work was selected for 'Chokusen Wakashu' (Anthology of Japanese Poetry compiled by Imperial command) ('Shika Wakashu' (Shika Collection of Japanese Poems)) as well as his son MINAMOTO no Suesada's ('Senzai Wakashu' (Collection of Japanese Poems of a Thousand Years)).

He was not a famous poet, although his work was selected for 'Chokusen Wakashu' (Anthology of Japanese Poetry compiled by Imperial command) ('Shika Wakashu' (Shika Collection of Japanese Poems)) as well as his son MINAMOTO no Suesada's ('Senzai Wakashu' (Collection of Japanese Poems of a Thousand Years)).

He was not a famous poet, although his work was selected for 'Chokusen Wakashu' (Anthology of Japanese Poetry compiled by Imperial command) ('Shika Wakashu' (Shika Collection of Japanese Poems)) as well as his son MINAMOTO no Suesada's ('Senzai Wakashu' (Collection of Japanese Poems of a Thousand Years)).

sen.j: いかなれば氷はとくる春かぜにむすぼゝるらむ青柳の糸 （詞花和歌集）
sen.e: I don't know how the spring breeze makes a knot in the branch of the green willow when ice melts (Shika Wakashu)
I don't know how the spring breeze makes a knot in the branch of the green willow when ice melts (Shika Wakashu)
I don't know how the spring breeze makes a knot in the branch of the green willow when ice melts (Shika Wakashu)

sen.j: 平家の郎党であったという以外にはわかっていない。
sen.e: He was known only as a retainer of the Taira family.
He was known only as a retainer of the Taira family.
He was known only as a retainer of the Taira family.

sen.j: 子の季貞は領地経営から後方支援、前線指揮までこなす優れた武将であったが、季遠には、それに類する逸話は残っていない。
sen.e: Though his son Suesada was an excellent busho who managed the territory management, the logistic support and the front operation, Suetoo had no story like this.
Though his son Suesada was an excellent busho who managed the territory, the logistic support and the front operation, there is no similar story of similar caliber concerning Suetoo.
Though his son Suesada was an excellent busho who managed the territory, the logistic support and the front operation, there is no similar story of similar caliber concerning Sueto.

sen.j: 二条天皇の皇太子時代に帯刀舎人。
sen.e: Tachihaki no toneri (guard of the crown prince) when Emperor Nijo was the crown prince.
sen.cmt: 帯刀舍人が登録ではTachihaki no toneri (guard of the Imperial Palace) 定訳不明、ですが、宮殿の護衛ではなく、皇太子の護衛らしいので、()内をguard of the crown princeに変更。
sen.e: Tachihaki no toneri (guard of the crown prince) when Emperor Nijo was the crown prince.
Tachihaki no toneri (guard of the crown prince) when Emperor Nijo was the crown prince.

sen.j: 後白河天皇時代に北面の武士。
sen.e: Hokumen no Bushi (the Imperial Palace Guards) in the time of Emperor Goshirakawa.
Hokumen no Bushi (the Imperial Palace Guards) in the time of Emperor Goshirakawa.
Hokumen no Bushi (the Imperial Palace Guards) in the time of Emperor Goshirakawa.

sen.j: 右兵衛尉、安芸守、信濃国国司を歴任。
sen.e: He served as Uhyoe no jo (officer of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards), Aki no kami (governor of Aki Province) and Kokushi (an officer of local government) in Shinano Province.
He served as Uhyoe no jo (officer of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards), Aki no kami (governor of Aki Province) and Kokushi (an officer of local government) in Shinano Province.
He served as Uhyoe no jo (officer of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards), Aki no kami (governor of Aki Province) and Kokushi (an officer of local government) in Shinano Province.

sen.j: 養父：源重時（清和源氏満政流）検非違使、大和守、越前守などを歴任。
sen.e: Adopted father: MINAMOTO no Shigetoki (Mitsumasa line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)), serving as Kebiishi (a police and judicial chief), Yamato no kami (governor of Yamato Province) and Echizen no kami (governor of Echizen Province).

Adopted father: MINAMOTO no Shigetoki (Mitsumasa line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)), serving as Kebiishi (a police and judicial chief), Yamato no kami (governor of Yamato Province) and Echizen no kami (governor of Echizen Province).

Adopted father: MINAMOTO no Shigetoki (Mitsumasa line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)), serving as Kebiishi (a police and judicial chief), Yamato no kami (governor of Yamato Province) and Echizen no kami (governor of Echizen Province).

sen.j: 実父：源忠宗（河内源氏・源義家の孫）上総国飯富庄司、飯富源太と称す。
sen.e: Natural father: MINAMOTO no Tadamune (Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), a grandson of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie), an officer of Obu Village in Kazusa Province, called as Genta OBU.
Natural father: MINAMOTO no Tadamune (Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), a grandson of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie), an officer of Obu Village in Kazusa Province, called as Genta OBU.
Natural father: MINAMOTO no Tadamune (Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), a grandson of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie), an officer of Obu Village in Kazusa Province, called as Genta OBU.

sen.j: 長男：源光季（又は光遠）豊後守などを歴任。
sen.e: The oldest son: MINAMOTO no Mitsusue (also called Mitsuto), serving as Bungo no kami (governor of Bungo Province).
The oldest son: MINAMOTO no Mitsusue (also called Mitsuto), serving as Bungo no kami (governor of Bungo Province).
The oldest son: MINAMOTO no Mitsusue (also called Mitsuto), serving as Bungo no kami (governor of Bungo Province).

sen.j: 次男：源季貞 検非違使。
sen.e: The second son: MINAMOTO no Suesada, Kebiishi.
The second son: MINAMOTO no Suesada, Kebiishi.
The second son: MINAMOTO no Suesada, Kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers).
sen.cmt: (officials with judicial and police powers)説明補足しました。
